Text.Value: Even Baldur's Gate's greatest warrior knew one blade alone cannot rout an army.
Cordula Eltan. Your family has a storied history in this city.
Mizora lied to you. We tried to save Ravengard, and she sabotaged us.

EditorData.logicalname: Skill_Persuasion - was in IRN, broken pact

Text.Value: I am Cordula Eltan, heir to the hero who forged the Fist.
My great grandfather built the Fist and forged its first blades.
A bronze dragon, to be precise, sleeping beneath us.
You. The githyanki who would shatter the Gate.
You. The gods-damned disease of the Gate.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Florrick appears with a cadre of allies from the upper city - patriars and their guards.

Text.Value: Stand down.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Eltan pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

Text.Value: It is said that only a true champion can awaken the Wyrm. Now that the Grand Duke has fallen, the duty falls to his son.
The Blade of Frontiers, nothing but a cold-blooded killer. I will make him and his allies pay for his father's death.
Free the wyrm, and may his thunderous wind drive the Absolute from the Coast.
First I finish you. Then I finish the duke's traitorous son.
Pitiful, how easy the lies come to you.
What darkness has fallen upon us.
Attack us, then. Let's see who's left standing.
Follow its path to the wyrm. Or do not, and let the Coast be drowned in blood.
Not a fairy tale, but a history, told far and wide by Balduran himself.
Probe her mind.
The dragon Ansur is dead.
The wyrm goes by many names. Ansur. The Waiting Storm. The Heart of the Gate.
With him gone and the city near ruin, your call is to unleash the Heart of the Gate.
Zariel's stunt destroyed countless lives. Mizora is her minion - you can't trust her.
I was right to lay down my arms, Foehammer be praised.
He understood that if the cult were successful in raising an army, Baldur's Gate would be doomed.
Why would this training matter?
How he means to make the city bow to him and him alone.
The fate of the city now rests with us.
The dragon Ansur is dead.

EditorData.logicalname: |Already dealt with Ansur, party did not take helm|

EditorData.stateContext: Eltan and her companions are at ease

Text.Value: Your faith in us is well-founded. We will seek the wyrm and ask for his help.
And he knew that to protect the city, one trained in the ways of the great champions would have to rouse the wyrm living beneath. If I'm not mistaken, that would be Wyll.
A relevant thread of knowledge pokes at your mind. Explore it.
Ravengard could still be alive. And we intend to save him.
A man of honour - much like Wyll's father. How cold is your heart, that you'd be his butcher?
*You remember the stories of Elturel's fall. The city was dragged into the Hells at Zariel's behest - and Ravengard along with it.*
Only a true champion can awaken the wyrm. As the Blade of Frontiers, Wyll has proven his worth. Please, give him this message.
The city's survived countless threats. But Ravengard knew its walls would fall to the cult.
Ravengard's death was Gortash's doing. There was nothing we could do.
I will not play your mind games. To arms!
Find it, and follow its path to the wyrm. Or do not, and let the Coast be drowned in blood.
I believe you, the Battle Lord help me.
The city has found its protector, thank you very much. Me.
He made Balduran a binding promise to protect the city when its need was greatest.
I should go, gather allies. We'll join you in your hour of need.
Take this - 'The Legend of Ansur'. The bards call it a tall tale. But every last word is true.
And you are the Hells' lowest dregs. I will not let Wyll take the city!
Dead? Blast - not what I wanted to hear.
We need to prepare for battle. I will head out and seek more allies to help our cause.
May Helm help us drive the Absolute from the Coast.
There is a tome - 'The Legend of Ansur'. The bards call it a tall tale. But every last word is true.
Stand down and name yourself.
The Blade has saved countless lives. He is still the man you thought he was.
Listen, there's something Wyll should know. On his way from Elturel, Ravengard sent a messenger with word of the cult.
Ravengard was that warrior. If his legacy is to live, you must release the wyrm.
He knew about the Absolute. I thought little of it at first - but he realised the danger before anyone else did.

EditorData.stateContext: Eltan and company in attack position

Text.Value: *Your thoughts come up short.*
Let the dragon sleep. We'll deal with the Absolute on our own terms.
You killed the best of Baldur's Gate. May the Hells make you suffer.
Please. You're staking the city's future on a fairy tale.
Do you mean there's a dragon living under the city?
Lady Mizora told me everything. How you and the Blade of Frontiers slaughtered his own father, how he craves ultimate power.

Synopsis: Confrontation with Eltan noble if Ravengard died and Florrick is dead or still in prison. Wyll is not with party in this version
